summary: This is an email chain from September 7, 2021, regarding the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case. Attorney Patricia A. Pileggi contacts a prosecutor to discuss a subpoena for her client, who has been summoned to appear in the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Patricia A. Pileggi
persons.context: Attorney representing a subpoenaed individual in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She reaches out to a prosecutor to discuss the subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the email correspondence.

connections.description: Pileggi is involved in the legal proceedings of the Maxwell case, representing a subpoenaed witness.

events.title: Attorney correspondence regarding Maxwell trial subpoena
events.description: Attorney Patricia A. Pileggi emails a prosecutor to discuss a subpoena issued to her client for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: An individual has been subpoenaed to appear as a witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Attorney Patricia A. Pileggi of Schiff Hardin LLP represents the subpoenaed individual.
The correspondence is dated September 7, 2021, during the pre-trial or trial phase of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email chain involves communication between a defense attorney and a prosecutor's office (USANYS).
The document is a privileged attorney communication regarding legal strategy for a witness in a high-profile case.
